intro: Helianthemum polifolium var. lineare, commonly known as the linear-leaved rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, featuring dense, evergreen foliage with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and limestone areas. This variety is valued for its hardiness and ornamental appeal in rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
